description.p: Your magic is the magic that exists within all living creatures ,the magic in blood. Those who continually loose blood slowly die from this however you are much more resilient, your blood is made much more for hematomancy.

description.p: At 1st level, your blood is more resistant then many other peoples. You can draw upon it as you grow. You gain an additional hit die, you gain another at 4th, 8th, 12th, 16th and 20th level. Additionally you have advantage on resisting poison.

sheet.description: At 1st level, your blood is more resistant then many other peoples. You can draw upon it as you grow. You gain an additional hit die, you gain another at 4th, 8th, 12th, 16th and 20th level (These are not shown on the sheet but do make a note.)

description.p: As you gain in your power you can tap on your life force to power your spells. You can take a number of d8s damage equivalent to the level of the spell that you are casting to reduce the spell slot to that of a cantrip. Additionally you can take a d8 damage to gain that number of sorcery points. This damage ignores all resistances and immunities. As you take damage you reduce your hit die by the number of d8 damage you take. (For a 5th level spell you take 5d8 damage and reduce your hit die by 5)

description.p: At 6th level, you gain the ability to cast spells through your wounds. when you take any form of damage that would make you bleed you can spend a sorcery point per spell level to use a reaction to cast a spell that would normally take an action or bonus action to cast.

description.p: At 14th level, when you fall below half your hit points you gain a +3 to AC, when you roll damage in this state you add your proficiency to the damage.

description.p: At 18th level, when your spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points you can spend two sorcery points to cause it to explode violently, the creature fails two death saving throws, all creatures in a 15 foot radius must make a dexterity saving throw or take 7d8 necrotic damage. You can use metamagic on this treating it as a necromancy spell.
